Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.2537 * Sketch scale: 0.0254 * Operation: Create a new solid body Part 2: Long, Thin, Metallic Object with a Slightly Curved Shape Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0322, 0.0142, 0.1139] Create a new sketch on the XY-plane of the coordinate system. Draw the following lines in this sketch: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.7105, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.7105, 0.0], End Point [0.7105, 0.0127] * Line 3: Start Point [0.7105, 0.0127], End Point [0.0, 0.0127] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0127], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.7105. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0322 * Sketch scale: 0.7105 * Operation: Add material to the existing body The final shape of the assembly is a long, thin, metallic object with a flat, rectangular base and a pointed, cylindrical top. The object has the following dimensions: * Length: 0.0254 meters * Width: 0.0254 meters * Height: 0.2537 meters Note: The sketches for each part are drawn on a plane defined by the coordinate system of the part. Each sketch can contain multiple faces, and each face can contain multiple loops. Each loop must be closed and can consist of multiple lines and/or arcs. The shape of each part is determined from the VLM model in the description. The boolean operation of the current part with the previous body is described in natural language instead of using specific terms such as "NewBodyFeatureOperation", "CutFeatureOperation", etc. The number of curves in each loop is not specified, as it is not necessary for generating an accurate CAD model.</description>
